question: Which do you find funniest?
ans: Goofy puns.
Tumblr memes.
Stand-up comedy clips.
Celebrity reaction videos.

question: You’re with your friends and see someone standing off by themselves. What do you do?
ans: Say hi and ask if everything’s okay.
Walk over and tell a joke to break the ice.
Invite them along to a big group activity that I carefully planned for next weekend.
Call them over, make introductions, and invite them to join the discussion.

question: What are your favorite topics to bring up with friends?
ans: I enjoy discussing topical things like the news or social issues.
I bring up pop culture topics and all the shows I’m watching.
I send them funny videos and memes all day, every day.
I talk about personal stuff (like who I’m crushing on!).

question: Your BFF just won an award! How do you react?
ans: I congratulate them sincerely and tell them how great they are.
I plan a celebratory party with our friends.
I talk up their accomplishment to everyone I know!
I just give them a great, big hug.

question: Your friend group is trying to make plans in the group chat. What are you doing?
ans: I say, “I can hang out whenever!” and let them figure out the rest.
I tell them when I’m free and try to help come up with the best time to hang.
I’m a little hard to pin down and say, “I’m free, but only before 12 or after 9!”
I’m the one who initiated the plans.

question: Your friend tells you they’re feeling super stressed. What’s your reaction?
ans: I comfort them and ask if there’s anything I can do to help.
I help them make a plan to deal with whatever is stressing them out.
I suggest we watch their favorite funny movie to lighten the mood.
I tell them not to worry—whatever it is will pass.

question: What superlative would you be most likely to win?
ans: Most Responsible
Biggest Goofball
Most Unique
Best Shoulder to Cry On

question: What were you like in elementary school?
ans: I spent all my time with my 2 closest friends.
I was super friendly, running from group to group like a social butterfly.
I was one of the popular kids—and hung out with the other popular kids.
I was a bit of a loner and sometimes struggled to make friends.

question: It’s your birthday. What kind of gift are you hoping to get?
ans: I just want a thoughtful party thrown by my besties.
I want a cool, artsy piece of clothing.
I want tickets to an exciting event, like an axe-throwing class or concert.
I want something practical I’ll actually use, like new stationery or a cozy blanket.

question: Your friend group is going to hang out this weekend. What activities do you suggest?
ans: I suggest we make a bunch of cool, hands-on crafts!
I suggest we have a sleepover and talk late into the night.
I suggest we go on an adventure to explore a brand-new hangout spot!
I suggest we relax! I’d like to lounge by a pool all day or watch movies.

question: What’s your biggest friendship red flag?
ans: Friends who cancel plans without warning.
Friends who ask for advice but never follow it.
Friends who ask to borrow money and don’t repay it.
Friends who ask to hang out but text other people the whole time.

question: Pick the band you like most!
ans: Queen
BTS
ABBA
Green Day
